results.title: Bridge over Myall Creek (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Samantha Butler, Brigid Donovan, Vanessa Gorman, Helen Gasswill, John Millard, Wendy Page, Margaret Parker and Caitlin Shea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
Caroline Jones introduces this episode of “Australian story” which looks at personal reconciliation in action as demonstrated by the relationship between Sue Blacklock and Beulah Adams, descendants of victim and perpetrator in the 1838 Myall Creek massacre. Researching into her family history, Beulah Adams discovered her great uncle was one of the perpetrators in a massacre that saw 28 Aborigines killed. Beulah talks candidly about her reaction to the news, and her experience at meeting Sue Blacklock, descendant of one of the two survivors at a conference on reconciliation convened by Reverend John Brown. Another descendant of the perpetrators, Des Blake, talks about his experience at attending the memorial’s opening at Myall Creek in 2002, and how the experience has changed his life since then.

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Pt. 1 [episodes 1-5]
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions, Derek Granger and Charles Sturridge
results.brief_description: This tape comprises of episodes one to five - the first half of the magnificent series set during World War II. It is dawn on a cold winter’s morning in 1943. Charles Ryder, painter turned army captain, in the twilight of World War II has marched most of the night and camped with his platoon at their secret destination. On waking, he is amazed to find he is at the rear of Brideshead Castle where he spent many years of enchantment and grief in his youth, and which, years ago he had left vowing never to return. Now here he was again, cold and with memories flooding over him like storm-surf on the shore. He was back. Brideshead revisited had begun. Cast includes Jeremy Irons, Anthony Andrews, Diana Quick, Laurence Olivier, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud. Adapted from the novel by Evelyn Waugh.

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Episodes 10 & 11
results.brief_description: Julia’s husband reluctantly agrees to a divorce in order that she can marry Charles. Lord Marchmain returns to Brideshead to die, and is horrified at his eldest son’s choice of wife, whom he describes as vulgar and unsuitable as mistress of Brideshead Castle. Finally, Julia’s Catholic beliefs weigh heavily upon her and she declares she cannot marry Charles. It is not until many years later that Charles learns that Lord Marchmain left Brideshead to Julia…and as his memory dissolves, Charles Ryder returns to 1943, to Brideshead Castle, which is now a bleak military encampment. Rated: PG

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Episodes 08 & 09
results.brief_description: It has been ten years since Charles has had contact with the Marchmain family. During this time he has become a successful painter, and also a husband…although his marriage soon lost its charms. It is not until he is returning by ship from New York that Charles meets Julia Marchmain, and they quickly become lovers. Charles’ last exhibition in London is a glittering success, but he is more concerned with returning to Brideshead, and Julia, and does not care that his wife has guessed of his affair. Rated: PG

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Episodes 06 & 07
results.brief_description: Charles, now painting in Paris, is blissfully unaware of the turbulent affairs of the Marchmain family until he hears that Lady Marchmain is terminally ill. Her dying wish is to see her youngest son, Sebastian, who has disappeared. Charles is asked to find Sebastian and return him to Brideshead before his mother dies. Charles finds Sebastian living in squalid conditions with a Foreign Legion deserter in North Africa, but drink and neglect have left him too ill to travel. Rated: PG

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Episodes 04 & 05
results.brief_description: Oxford University cannot contain Sebastian or Charles. By summer’s end Charles leaves Oxford for art. Sebastian leaves for the bottle. Almost a year goes by before Charles is invited back to Brideshead where he is horrified to discover Sebastian is now a confirmed drunkard. Finally, Charles realises there is nothing more he can do to save his friend, so he leaves Brideshead declaring, “I leave a part of myself behind.” Rated: PG

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Episodes 02 & 03
results.brief_description: After a golden summer spent at Brideshead with Sebastian, Charles goes with his friend to Venice where Lord Marchmain is living with his mistress, Carla. It is there that Carla offers a prophetic insight into Sebastian’s future, saying, “He will be a drunkard”. later, over Christmas of that year, Charles’ growing friendship with the rest of the Marchmain family results in Sebastian turning away from Charles. Sebastian turns to “the bottle”.

results.title: Brides of Christ (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Sue Masters and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: A six hour mini-series based on the lives of Sr. Catherine and Sr. Paul who enter the convent in the early 50’s. Behind high convent walls, their lives are circumscribed by centuries old traditions, rites and disciplines, yet they must become part of a changing world. For many, their faith will be sufficient to carry them through their personal crisis. In their care are spirited teenagers, schooled in the old creed, yet eager to taste the new freedoms. Starring Brenda Fricker, Sandy Gore, Josephine Byrnes, Lisa Hensley, Naomi Watts and Kym Wilson.
